catalog.name: Resource
catalog.description:
This collection includes information on the renewable energy resources available in the area, which is essential for a detailed characterization of the study area and for analyzing the development potential of an energy system in the area. These data can be valid inputs to models for the energy planning of the territory.

Stock photo by Vecteezy

members.name: Wind
members.description: This collection includes information on the wind resource available on the territory. For more details refer to the dedicated wind atlas AEOLIAN and to the paper A new Wind Atlas to support the expansion of the Italian windpower fleet.

members.name: Hydroelectric
members.description: This collection includes information about the hydroelectric resource.

members.name: Maximum hydroelectric potential (GWh/year)
members.description:
The maps of the maximum hydroelectric potential show the maximum gross energy obtainable from hydroenergy exploitation (GWh/year) in each sub-basin considered in the Italian territory. The calculation considers the spatial distribution of the average annual precipitation, the flow coefficients, the topographic relief (DEM) and the minimum vital flow (DMV) equal to 10% of the natural flow.
It is important to underline that the calculation does not take into account the current uses of water (hydroelectric, irrigation, potable, etc.) and therefore the total value of the maximum Italian hydroelectric producibility is approximately 190,000 GWh/year. This purely theoretical value would imply being able to convert all the available water potential into electrical energy, an unrealistic hypothesis from both a technical and an environmental point of view. A plausible value of the actual exploitation can be considered approximately 25% of the maximum hydroelectric producibility, a percentage that could be reached and possibly exceeded with the construction of distributed generation plants (mini-hydroelectric).

Two components are considered for the calculation of the maximum potential:
  • the basin's own production capacity;
  • the producibility deriving from the flow rates that come from upstream, with jump from upstream height to downstream height.


The two components for calculating the maximum hydroelectric potential

To explore the issue relating to the hydroelectric resource of a specific river basin, you can use the tools developed in RdS: VAPIDRO-ASTE allows you to automatically calculate the river network of the area of ​​interest. The user chooses a river branch in which he wants to calculate the potential hydroelectric producibility along the different river stretches. To deepen the aspects of technical and economic feasibility, the software SMART Mini-Idro allows you to analyze different project proposals by identifying the most convenient one.

Data Download

members.name: Specific hydroelectric potential (GWh/year/m)
members.description:
The maps of the maximum hydroelectric potential illustrate the maximum specific energy for unit length obtainable from hydroenergy exploitation (GWh/year/m) in each sub-basin considered in the Italian territory. The calculation takes into account the spatial distribution of the average annual precipitation, the flow coefficients, the topographic relief (DEM) and the minimum vital flow (DMV) equal to 10% of the natural flow.

The specific potential considers two different energy contributions:
  • the basin's own production capacity;
  • the producibility deriving from the flow rates coming from upstream, with Hupstream-Hdownstream head.


The two components for calculating the maximum hydroelectric potential

The energy coming from the exploitation of the upstream flow rates is related to the distance L, corresponding to the structural development of a hypothetical plant which draws water from the inlet point of the basins that flow upstream and returns it to the closing section of the basin under analysis; the own energy is instead related to an equivalent distance, defined as the square root of the basin surface.

Methodology for drafting maps of hydroelectric production at the basin scale Per approfondire la tematica relativa alla risorsa idroelettrica di uno specifico bacino fluviale si può ricorrere a dei tool sviluppati in RdS: Software SMART Mini-Idro


Data Download

members.name: BIGBANG 6.0 data
members.description: This collection includes part of the data processed and aggregated resulting from the BIGBANG 6.0 (Bilancio Idrologico GIS BAsed a scala Nazionale su Griglia regolare) hydrological model developed by ISPRA for the estimation of the hydrological balance components on a regular grid of 1 km of spatial resolution covering the entire national territory and on a monthly basis (https://www.isprambiente.gov.it/pre_meteo/idro/BIGBANG_ISPRA.html). </br> Original data can be downloaded at the following link: https://groupware.sinanet.isprambiente.it/bigbang-data/library/bigbang_60/ascii_grid

members.name: Flow duration curve
members.description:
Duration curves for the assessment of foreseeable water availability at the closure section of a predetermined hydrographic basin. Processing is available in the following areas: Abruzzo-Marche, Adamello and Orobie and Graian and Pennine Alps.

Additional information: Software SMART Mini-Idro

members.name: Solar
members.description: This collection includes information about the solar resource. For further information, see the dedicated solar atlas SunRISE

members.name: Average value of the annual sum of global radiation (kWh/m²)
members.description:
Map of the average global radiation referring to the period 2005-2015 and expressed in kWh/m2 The map was created using data from the RADSAF archive of global ground irradiance estimated on the Italian territory, using a methodology developed by RSE. The methodology is based on the processing of images taken by the MSG (Meteosat Second Generation) geostationary satellite placed at an altitude of 36,000 km above the Gulf of Guinea which entirely covers the Italian territory. The spatial resolution of the images is about 3-5 km, the temporal resolution of 15 minutes. An algorithm called SAFNWC, jointly developed by various European meteorological institutes, allows automatic recognition of cloud cover and its type starting from the satellite images acquired every 15 minutes by a ground receiving station with which RSE is equipped.

Information about the SOLAR RESOURCE layer
Solar Atlas (sunRiSE).

members.name: Offshore wave potential
members.description: This collection includes information on offshore wave potential.

members.name: Offshore wave motion
members.description:
Map of average wave power density (kW/m) at predefined points. Within the information associated with each point are reported in addition to the average wave energy (kW/m), also the depth (m) and distance from the coast (km) for which the offshore wave motion conditions are verified. For further information: - Besio, G., Mentaschi, L. and Mazzino, A., 2016. Wave energy resource assessment in the Mediterranean Sea on the basis of a 35-year hindcast. Energy, 94, pp.50-63. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.energy.2015.10.044 - Lira-Loarca, A., Ferrari, F., Mazzino, A. and Besio, G., 2021. Future wind and wave energy resources and exploitability in the Mediterranean Sea by 2100. Applied Energy, Elsevier vol.302, https://doi.org/10.1016/j.apenergy.2021.117492 - RSE report RdS prot. 20010732

members.name: Marine Data
members.description: This collection includes the localization of the National Mareographic and Wavemetric Network - ISPRA (Higher Institute for Environmental Protection and Research)

members.name: National Wavemetric Network
members.description:
National Wavemetric Network - Dataset. The National Wave Measurement Network (RON), is ISPRA's wave motion detection system, consisting of a network of fifteen measuring stations at fixed points along the national coasts for the collection of data which, properly processed, characterize the state of the sea. The descriptive parameters derive from the continuous observation of the variation of the sea surface through directional wave buoys and are processed at regular time intervals according to the definitions of the guideline n.702 'Guide to wave analysis and forecasting' of the World Meteorological Organization (WMO). Additional information:

National Wavemetric Network - Dataset.

National Monitoring Network - ISPRA .

members.name: National Tide Gauge Network
members.description:
The National Tide Gauge Network (NMR) is composed of 36 measuring stations uniformly distributed throughout the country and located mainly within the port facilities. All stations are equipped with a local data management and storage system and a transmission device (UMTS) in real time to the ISPRA headquarters in Rome. In addition, in 9 strategic stations for the measurement of particular phenomena (anomalous waves) there is a second satellite data transmission system with IRIDIUM technology that guarantees the connection even in the presence of black-out situations of the UMTS system. Since the new National Tide Gauge Network is fully operational, ISPRA has been providing users with updated information relating to time series, real-time observations, astronomical tide data forecasting, data analysis for design and scientific purposes. Additional information:

National Tide Gauge Network - Dataset.

National Monitoring Network - ISPRA .

members.name: Measurement campaigns
members.description: This collection includes measurements made at monitoring points

members.name: Wave measurement campaigns - Civitavecchia
members.description:
Measurements of wave motion and current flows carried out in the periods: 9th February 2017 - 12th March 2017, 12th March 2017 - 08th June 2017 and 10th October 2017 - 20th December 2017, in the stretch of sea in front of the port of Civitavecchia at about 40 m depth: wave height, currents, speed and direction, peak period, available power. Additional information:

RSE RdS document prot. 17002141.

Data Download

members.name: MOBI buoy measurement campaigns - Strait of Sicily
members.description:
MOBI - Offshore measuring station on floating buoy
Data includes anemometric, wave and current flow measurements acquired between 2018 and 2019.

Data download

members.name: Power flow of currents (W/m²)
members.description:
Map of the specific power flow of marine currents in Italian seas on a synoptic scale (RSE Report RdS prot. 12000352 of 03/31/2012). The spatial resolution of the results obtained is in fact linked to the temporal resolution of the current values ​​used for processing. Reference is made to the numerical results available at http://marine.copernicus.eu, with daily current values ​​relating to the period 2004-2010, with a horizontal resolution of approximately 7 km and arranged on 71 vertical levels. Only sites close enough to the coast (maximum 10 km away) and at fairly modest depths (less than 50 m) are considered feasible. The specific power flow represents the power supplied by the current per unit of useful section of the turbine, at the point along the vertical line, where this flow has its maximum value. The resulting map provides general indications (given the approximation linked to the temporal resolution of the speed averages) for meso- and micro-scale studies, for the purpose of exploiting energy from marine currents in Italian waters.

Information about the MARINE RESOURCE layer MARENERGY

Data Download

members.name: Geothermal
members.description: This collection includes information about the geothermal resource.

members.name: Heat flow (mW/m²)
members.description:
Superficial heat flux map expressed in mW/m2 prepared by RSE S.p.A. using the data collected in the Inventory of National Geothermal Resources available on the website of the Ministry of Ecological Transition - UNMIG (https://unmig.mise.gov.it/index.php/it/dati/risorse-geotermiche/inventario-delle-risorse-geotermiche-nazionali). Additional information: GEO WebGIS CCS -- Geothermal -- Gas storage

Data Download

members.name: Potential reservoir top level (m asl)
members.description:
The map shows the top level, in meters asl, of the roof of the potential carbonate tank. The carbonate complex, being characterized by a significant permeability, by considerable thicknesses and by a high area extension, is the main reservoir of Italian geothermal fields. The map was elaborated by RSE S.p.A. starting from the data collected in the Inventory of National Geothermal Resources available on the website of the Ministry of Economic Development - DGS-UNMIG (https://unmig.mise.gov.it/index.php/it/dati/risorse-geotermiche/inventario-delle-risorse-geotermiche-nazionali). Additional information: GEO WebGIS CCS -- Geothermal -- Gas storage

Data Download

members.name: Geothermal zoning
members.description:
Geothermal zoning supports the identification on a municipal scale of areas in which there are significant increases in subsoil temperatures at lower depths than the average which generate the theoretical conditions necessary to draw heat, supporting the identification of a possible geothermal fluid reservoir industrially usable. This map shows the following information for each municipality: - the minimum, average and maximum temperature (°C) at 1,000, 2,000 and 3,000 meters of depth (fields: T1000, T2000 and T3000); - The minimum, average and maximum heat flow (mW/m2) (fields: Flow) ; - the minimum, average and maximum depth (meters) of the roof of rocks potentially suitable for containing a geothermal system (carbonate reservoir roof where mapped) (fields: Carbo). NThe map displayed shows, by way of example, the distribution of the average temperature parameter at a depth of 1,000 m, but by selecting the appropriate legend it is possible to view the distribution of the other parameters present. Additional information: GEO WebGIS CCS -- Geothermal -- Gas storage

Data Download

members.name: temperature at homogeneous depth
members.description: This collection includes information about the temperature at homogeneous depth.

members.name: Temperature at 1000 m depth (°C)
members.description:

Additional information: GEO WebGIS CCS -- Geothermal -- Gas storage

members.name: Temperature at 2000 m depth (°C)
members.description:
Map of subsoil temperatures expressed in degrees Celsius at a depth of 2000 meters from ground level. Map developed by RSE S.p.A. starting from the data collected in the Inventory of National Geothermal Resources available on the website of the Ministry of Ecological Transition - UNMIG (https://unmig.mise.gov.it/index.php/it/dati/risorse-geotermiche/inventario-delle-risorse-geotermiche-nazionali). Additional information: GEO WebGIS CCS -- Geothermal -- Gas storage

Data Download

members.name: Depth of areas with homogeneous temperature of 70° C
members.description:
Depth map of areas where a temperature of 70 °C is found, considering a maximum depth of 5000 m*.
* For Sardinia region, the maximum depth of investigation is 2000 m.
Map developed by RSE S.p.A. starting from the data collected in the Inventory of National Geothermal Resources (UNMIG - https://unmig.mase.gov.it/risorse-geotermiche/inventario-delle-risorse-geotermiche-nazionali/) and in the VIGOR project archive (http://www.vigor-geotermia.it/).



Data Download

members.name: Producible geothermal potential (MWh/year)
members.description:
Geothermal map potential at municipal level: for the areas of the Italian territory that have a temperature greater than or equal to 120°C, the estimate of the geothermal potential expressed as thermal energy obtainable per year (MWh/year) is shown. This estimate was made using the volume method. - Map developed by RSE S.p.A. starting from the data collected in the Inventory of National Geothermal Resources available on the website of the Ministry of Ecological Transition - UNMIG (https://unmig.mise.gov.it/index.php/it/dati/risorse-geotermiche/inventario-delle-risorse-geotermiche-nazionali).



Data Download

mtadata link

members.name: Thermal conductivity 0-70m (W/m/K) - points
members.description:
Average thermal conductivity of the soil, referring to the first 70 m of depth, in dry conditions (absence of water table). It was calculated as a weighted average of the thermal conductivity values of the lithologies present in the subsoil at the indicated site, based on the thicknesses of each stratigraphic level. The thermal conductivity value assigned to each lithology was taken from literature data. The stratigraphy referred to is available in the National Archive of Subsoil Investigations - ISPRA. Data processing by RSE S.p.A. - UNMIG (https://unmig.mise.gov.it/index.php/it/dati/risorse-geotermiche/inventario-delle-risorse-geotermiche-nazionali).



Data Download

members.name: Thermal conductivity 0-70m (W/m/K) - areas
members.description:
Average thermal conductivity of the soil, referring to the first 70 m of depth, in dry conditions (absence of water table). It was calculated by interpolating the specific values of average thermal conductivity in the first 70 m of subsoil. Data processing by RSE S.p.A.



Data Download

members.name: Thermal potential 0-70m (W/m) - points
members.description:
Average thermal potential of the soil, referring to the first 70 m of depth, in dry conditions (absence of water table). It was calculated as a weighted average of the thermal potential values of the lithologies present in the subsoil at the indicated site, based on the thicknesses of each stratigraphic level. The thermal potential value assigned to each lithology was taken from literature data. The stratigraphy referred to is available in the National Archive of Subsoil Investigations - ISPRA. Data processing by RSE S.p.A. - UNMIG (https://unmig.mise.gov.it/index.php/it/dati/risorse-geotermiche/inventario-delle-risorse-geotermiche-nazionali).



Data Download
